item.title: Drops
item.dc:creator: @gs1 gs
item.description:
@gs1 wrote:

paste this in item 3
your last one of this in item 3 should have 2 brackets at the end like
}
}
the @@@@ is what you want to name the monsterid thing so you rember when you go back you know its what ever monster you place
you probably shouldnâ€™t not use spaces and rember the name you need it later you must have the exact same letters capitalized or uncapitalized

public static int @@@@[] = {????, ????}; <-- the questionmarks are items you want monster to drop public static int random@@@@@() { return @@@@[(int)(Math.random()*@@@@.length)]; }

now in npc handler search

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType ==

then go to your last one of that it should have to brackets at the end like
}
}

paste this somewhere but not in the middle of one of the other monsters

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == ####) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item3.random@@@@(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }
@@@ is the name from item3 you named it

is the monsters id

Yw
